alert.note: Alert for Brunswick; Lunenburg; Mecklenburg (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 08 at 5:59PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of Mecklenburg, southern Lunenburg and southwestern Brunswick Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 559 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Boydton, or 7 miles southeast of Chase City, moving east at 30 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph, pea size hail, and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Reduced visibility and minor flooding possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... South Hill and La Crosse around 625 PM EDT. Brodnax around 630 PM EDT. Ebony around 640 PM EDT. Brunswick and Gasburg around 645 PM EDT. Other locations impacted by this storm include Cochran, Beechwood, Bowens Corner, John H Kerr Dam, North View, Finchley, White Plains, Meredithville, Skipwith and Forksville. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Be prepared for rapid changes in weather and road conditions. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
